title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: install package, start R enter: now load packages needed current vignette:
code: if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager")  if (!require("MDSvis", quietly = TRUE))     BiocManager::install("MDSvis") library(HDCytoData) library(CytoMDS) library(MDSvis)

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: MDSvis package implements visualization Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects representing low dimensional projection sample distances. objects can obtained using features implemented CytoMDS package (Hauchamps et al. (2025)). information see CytoMDS vignette. visualization done via Shiny app allows user interactively customise plots depending series input parameters (see CytoMDS::ggplotSampleMDS() function details parameters). IMPORTANT: example provided current vignette uses cytometry data. result, distance matrix, contains pairwise sample distances, serves input MDS projection, calculated cytometry data samples using CytoMDS package. However, input MDS object can also calculated distance matrix, units interest necessarily cytometry samples. demonstrated additional vignette.

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: load illustrative mass cytometry (CyTOF) dataset (Krieg et al. 2018), accessible Bioconductor HDCytoData data package (Weber Soneson (2019)). Krieg_Anti_PD_1 used characterize immune cell subsets peripheral blood melanoma skin cancer patients treated anti-PD-1 immunotherapy. study found frequency CD14+CD16-HLA-DRhi monocytes baseline samples (taken patients prior treatment) strong predictor survival response immunotherapy treatment. Notably, dataset contains strong batch effect, due sample acquisition two different days (Krieg et al. (2018)).

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: current section, show build input objects needed shiny app, step step. However, interested description app functionalities, might decide launch application demo mode - automatically pre-loads Krieg_Anti_PD_1 dataset - jump next section. First load Krieg_Anti_PD_1 dataset, HDCytoData package. Next build phenodata dataframe experimental design information, found cytometry data structures. Next, scale-transform mass cytometry data calculate pairwise distance matrix. distance matrix, can now calculate MDS projection. also done using CytoMDS package. Optionally, use biplots interpretation tool, sample specific statistics can provided user. calculate standard univariate statistics variable multidimensional distribution (using CytoMDS package). newly created objects can saved .rds files. files can turn selected within shiny app visualization.
code: Krieg_fs <- Krieg_Anti_PD_1_flowSet() ## see ?HDCytoData and browseVignettes('HDCytoData') for documentation ## loading from cache ## Warning in updateObjectFromSlots(object, ..., verbose = verbose): dropping ## slot(s) 'colnames' from object = 'flowSet' Krieg_fs ## A flowSet with 20 experiments. ##  ## column names(49): Pd104Di Pd105Di ... batch_id sample_id # update phenoData structure  chLabels <-      keyword(Krieg_fs[[1]], "MARKER_INFO")$MARKER_INFO$channel_name chMarkers <-      keyword(Krieg_fs[[1]], "MARKER_INFO")$MARKER_INFO$marker_name marker_class <-      keyword(Krieg_fs[[1]], "MARKER_INFO")$MARKER_INFO$marker_class  chLabels <- chLabels[marker_class != "none"] chMarkers <- chMarkers[marker_class != "none"] # marker_class all equal to "type", 24 markers are left  phenoData <- flowCore::pData(Krieg_fs) additionalPhenoData <-      keyword(Krieg_fs[[1]], "EXPERIMENT_INFO")$EXPERIMENT_INFO phenoData <- cbind(phenoData, additionalPhenoData)      flowCore::pData(Krieg_fs) <- phenoData # transform flow set (arcsinh(cofactor = 5)) trans <- arcsinhTransform(     transformationId="ArcsinhTransform",      a = 0,      b = 1/5,      c = 0)  # Applying arcsinh() transformation Krieg_fs_trans <- transform(     Krieg_fs,     transformList(chLabels, trans))  # Calculating Sample distances pwDist <- pairwiseEMDDist(     Krieg_fs_trans,     channels = chMarkers,     verbose = FALSE ) mdsObj <- computeMetricMDS(     pwDist,     seed = 0)  show(mdsObj) ## MDS object containing MDS projection (using Smacof algorithm)  data: ## Nb of dimensions:  2  ## Nb of points:  20  ## Stress:  0.052363  ## Pseudo RSquare:  0.984008  ## Goodness of fit:  0.997258 # Computing sample statistics  statFUNs <- c(     "median" = stats::median,      "std-dev" = stats::sd,     "mean" = base::mean,     "Q25" = function(x, na.rm)          stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.25, na.rm = na.rm),     "Q75" = function(x, na.rm)          stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.75, na.rm = na.rm))  chStats <- CytoMDS::channelSummaryStats(     Krieg_fs_trans,     channels = chMarkers,     statFUNs = statFUNs) saveRDS(mdsObj, file = "Krieg_mdsObj.rds") saveRDS(phenoData, file = "Krieg_phenoData.rds") saveRDS(chStats, file = "Krieg_chStats.rds")

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: MDSvis function run_app launches interactive Shiny app three tabs window figure gets opened. ‘Input files’ tab objects can loaded visualization. plots shown ‘View’ tab ‘General settings’ contains technical plot settings controls. input files expected .rds extension least file containing MDS object loaded. Optionally phenodata file containing phenodata dataframe /file containing list statistics biplot visualization can loaded. Alternatively, ‘demo mode’ (see commented code chunck ) allows user launch app Krieg_Anti_PD_1 dataset pre-loaded, without importing input .rds files. can select previously created files proceed visualization. Note phenodata file selected new control appears allowing select subset variables (default selected). phenodata selected variables ones available drop-list controls ‘View’ tab. can now open ‘View’ tab see plot projection results. controls side allow choose projection axes; colour, label, define facet shape points according phenodata variables; add biplot; show plotly plot interactive plot exploration flip axes. example can colour points according group_id, label points according sample_id, use shapes according batch_id, shown figure . can also defne facets according two batches, figure :  can also add biplot created based sample statistics clicking biplot checkbox. idea calculate correlation sample statistics w.r.t. axes projection, correlations can represented correlation circle overlaid projection plot. desired statistic can selected drop menu possible show arrows respect selected length threshold. example , chosen statistic median arrow length threshold 0.8.  data large displayed labels, one possible solution display interactive plotly plot regular one selecting corresponding checkbox. can add new plotly tooltips highlight corresponding information point hovering .  Finally, obtained plots can exported pdf file. user can defined corresponding plot title, pdf file name plot size (height) used.
code: MDSvis::mdsvis_app()  # alternatively launch the application in demo mode, with the Krieg_Anti_PD_1 # dataset already loaded. #MDSvis::mdsvis_app(preLoadDemoDataset = TRUE)

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: completeness show ‘General settings’ tab contains general controls regarding e.g. points features, corresponding labels biplot arrows. details see CytoMDS::ggplotSampleMDS() function parameters.

title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: short vignette complementary main MDSvis package vignette, provides overview MDSvis Shiny application (app) features. focus ‘’ create input objects, need provided Shiny app. vignette, show can take advantage Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) interactive visualisations, starting distance matrix, sample specific properties.

title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: install package, start R enter (un-commented): now load packages needed current vignette:
code: if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager")  if (!require("MDSvis", quietly = TRUE))     BiocManager::install("MDSvis") library(CytoMDS) library(MDSvis)

title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: vignette, use frog skin active peptide (fsap) dataset. consists 226 samples, sample represents amino acid sequence corresponding reported amphibian host defense peptide. Distances peptides can obtained using pairwise alignments computing appropriate dissimilarity metric amino acid sequences. details, see fsap dataset methods section . top peptide distances, peptide properties also collected: - Uniprot accession number - taxonomic family, genus, species - physicochemical parameters following code, import two text files dataset: - distance matrix file (imported R matrix) - sample properties file (imported R data.frame)
code: # inputs inputDir <- system.file("extdata", package = "MDSvis") distPath <- file.path(inputDir, "fsap_mature_226_distances.txt") propPath <- file.path(inputDir, "fsap_mature_226_properties.txt")  # reading distance matrix from disk distData <- read.delim(distPath) rownames(distData) <- distData$X distData$X <- NULL distMat <- as.matrix(distData)  # reading properties propDF <- read.delim(propPath)

what: Generation of input files for the Shiny application
title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: still need pre-process data properties split two parts: - variables used annotate plots, associate colour, shape, faceting etc. variable mostly factor variables. extract phenoData object - needs data.frame. - continuous variables can exploited sample statistics bi-plots. need included list statistics object. frequency tables peptides belonging different families, genera species. distance matrix, now need calculate MDS projection object, used main input Shiny app. done using CytoMDS package. set number projection dimensions 10. See documentation CytoMDS::computeMetricMDS() details possible options. newly created objects can saved .rds files. files can turn selected within shiny app visualization.
code: # split properties between factors and continuous variables (stats)  statMat <- as.matrix(propDF[, -1]) statList <- list(quant_properties = statMat)  propDF <- propDF[, 1, drop = FALSE] propDF$family <- factor(substr(propDF$Sequence_Name, start = 1, stop = 3)) propDF$genus <- factor(substr(propDF$Sequence_Name, start = 1, stop = 6)) propDF$species <- factor(substr(propDF$Sequence_Name, start = 1, stop = 8)) table(propDF$family) ##  ## HYL MIC RAN  ##  43   7 176 table(propDF$genus) ##  ## HYL_AG HYL_CR HYL_HP HYL_HY HYL_LD HYL_LI HYL_PH HYL_PL HYL_SP MIC_KA RAN_AM  ##      9      2      2      1      2      7     17      2      1      7     10  ## RAN_BA RAN_FE RAN_GL RAN_HD RAN_LB RAN_NA RAN_OD RAN_PE RAN_RA RAN_SY RAN_TH  ##     15      1      2      1     15      3     63     19     16     30      1 table(propDF$species) ##  ## HYL_AGca HYL_AGda HYL_CRca HYL_HPci HYL_HPra HYL_HYsi HYL_LDpu HYL_LIfa  ##        6        3        2        1        1        1        2        4  ## HYL_LIin HYL_PHbi HYL_PHhy HYL_PLth HYL_SPla MIC_KAma MIC_KAse RAN_AMha  ##        3       10        7        2        1        2        5        4  ## RAN_AMlo RAN_BAad RAN_BApl RAN_FEca RAN_GLru RAN_HDma RAN_LBca RAN_LBpi  ##        6        5       10        1        2        1        7        8  ## RAN_NApa RAN_NApl RAN_ODan RAN_ODli RAN_PEle RAN_PEni RAN_RAbo RAN_RAch  ##        2        1       47       16        4       15        5       11  ## RAN_SYni RAN_SYsp RAN_THkw  ##       13       17        1 MDSObj <- CytoMDS::computeMetricMDS(pwDist = distMat,                                      nDim = 10)  show(MDSObj) ## MDS object containing MDS projection (using Smacof algorithm)  data: ## Nb of dimensions:  10  ## Nb of points:  226  ## Stress:  0.156626  ## Pseudo RSquare:  0.829141  ## Goodness of fit:  0.975468 # outputs (for shiny app) MDSRDSPath <- "fsap_mature_MDS.rds" statRDSPath <- "fsap_mature_stats.rds" propRDSPath <- "fsap_mature_props.rds"  # saving objects  saveRDS(MDSObj, file = MDSRDSPath) saveRDS(statList, file = statRDSPath) saveRDS(propDF, file = propRDSPath)

title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: MDSvis function run_app launches interactive Shiny app. , can take look main MDSvis vignette overview Shiny app features. screen shot Shiny app, displaying view MDS projection fsap dataset.

what: Data mining and assembly of a reference dataset
title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: construction initial dataset known amphibian host defense peptides, sequences belonging “frog skin active peptide” superfamily (FSAP; InterPro: IPR016322) collected Uniprot database relevant literature. FSAP higher-level taxonomic classifications Ranidae, Microhylidae Hyloidea differentiated using prefixes RAN_, MIC_ HYL_, respectively. designations broadly referred “family” throughout vignette. family prefix followed letter code identify genus species FSAP identified, followed unique Uniprot accession. FSAP precursor protein composed tripartite structure N-terminal signal peptide spacer regions enzymatically cleaved release bioactive, “mature” peptide. total 226 mature FSAP thus identified used subsequent analysis.

what: Pairwise alignments using primary structure and hydrophobicity
title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: Pairwise alignments mature FSAP sequences generated AlignMe 1.2 (Stamm et al. 2013) using combined scale incorporates Hessa, White von Heinje hydropathy scale (HWvH; weight: 2.6 (Hessa et al. 2007) VTML substitution matrix (weight: 0.5), according developer’s recommendations. Gap penalties similarly based (Stamm et al. 2014) set follows: threshold gap opening penalty: 18.0, threshold gap extension penalty: 1.3, threshold gap opening penalty: 11.0, threshold gap extension penalty 4.4: thresholds penalties: 0; termini gap opening penalty 13.1; termini gap extension penalty: 0.9 (Stamm et al. 2014). Given short lengths mature FSAP sequences, window size set 0 prevent smoothing effect. Absolute differences hydrophobicity measurements generated peptide pair calculated used construct distance, dissimilarity matrix.

title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: following parameters calculated mature FSAP sequence: 1. peptide length (number amino acids) 2. grand average hydropathy, GRAVY index (obtained dividing sum hydropathy values amino acids total sequence length), determine hydrophobicity/hydrophilicity protein; positive index indicates hydrophobic character, whereas negative index indicates hydrophilic character 3. hydrophobic moment (measure amphipathicity structure, asymmetry hydrophobicity, quantifying distribution hydrophobic hydrophilic residues along length; particularly relevant α-helices) 4. isoelectric point, pI (pH peptide carries net electrical charge zero) 5. molar mass 6. net charge pH 7 7. cysteine content (%) 8. ratio lysines arginines (e.g., changes ratio α-helical peptides can affect hydrophobicity required membrane perturbation)

title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties
text: like thank Kim Roelants devising method calculate distances FSAP, described fsap dataset methods section current vignette.

title: Preparing `MDSvis` input objects from a distance matrix and sample properties

title: Authors and Citation
text: Philippe H, Andrea V, Laurent G (2025). “MDSvis, Shiny application interactive visualisation Multi Dimensional Scaling projections.” bioRxiv, 2025.06.23.660991. doi:10.1101/2025.06.23.660991.
code: @Article{,   title = {{MDSvis}, a Shiny application for interactive visualisation of               Multi Dimensional Scaling projections},   author = {Hauchamps Philippe and Vicini Andrea and Gatto Laurent},   journal = {bioRxiv},   pages = {2025.06.23.660991},   month = {jun},   year = {2025},   language = {en},   doi = {10.1101/2025.06.23.660991}, }

title: Plots of MDS results
text: MDSvis package implements visualisation Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects representing low dimensional projection cytometry samples. objects can obtained using functionalities implemented CytoMDS package. visualisation realised via Shiny app allows user interactively customise plots depending series input parameters. screenshot app ‘View’ tab. controls side allow choose projection axes, colour, label, facet shape points according phenodata variables, add biplot, show plotly plot interactive plot exploration flip axes.

title: Plots of MDS results
text: install package run following lines: Note CytoMDS version 1.3.5 needs installed .

title: Plots of MDS results
text: MDSvis code provided GPL license version 3.0 higher. documentation, including manual pages vignettes, distributed CC -SA 4.0 license.

title: Plots of MDS results
text: use MDSvis research, please use following citation: Hauchamps, Philippe, Simon Delandre, Stéphane T. Temmerman, Dan Lin, Laurent Gatto. 2025. “Visual Quality Control CytoMDS, Bioconductor Package Low Dimensional Representation Cytometry Sample Distances.” Cytometry. Part : Journal International Society Analytical Cytology 107 (3): 177–86.
